edu.spa.ftclib.internal.drivetrain

Class TankDrivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.spa.ftclib.internal.drivetrain.Drivetrain
      • edu.spa.ftclib.internal.drivetrain.TankDrivetrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Positionable, Rotatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HeadingableTankDrivetrain

    public class TankDrivetrain
extends Drivetrain
implements Rotatable, Positionable
    Created by Gabriel on 2017-12-27. A simple drivetrain with two drive wheels.

        public void setRotation(double rotation)
        Specified by:
        setRotation in interface Rotatable
        Parameters:
        rotation - the velocity that you want to rotate the robot by. Counterclockwise is positive and clockwise is negative. Zero is if you don't want to rotate the robot.

      • calculateMotorPowers

        protected double[] calculateMotorPowers()
        Calculates the motor powers. It combines the velocity you gave it and the rotation that you gave it
        Specified by:
        calculateMotorPowers in class Drivetrain
        Returns:
        the motorPowers array, which will then be sent to the motors to tell them how fast to move

      • isPositioning

        public boolean isPositioning()
        Use this as a loop condition (with {@link #updatePosition in the loop body) if you want to move to a specific position and then move on to other code.
        Specified by:
        isPositioning in interface Positionable
        Returns:
        Whether or not the drivetrain is still moving towards the target position

      • getTicksPerUnit

        public double getTicksPerUnit()
        Depending on the encoder type, the number of ticks per rotation can vary. This method uses motor configuration data to calculate that number.
        Specified by:
        getTicksPerUnit in interface Positionable
        Returns:
        the number of encoder ticks per rotation
